title: What is difference between new iPhone and Unlocked iPhone? - Quora

response.answer_text: I unlocked my iPhone because it allows me to personalize it more. I use an AppStore called Cydia that has hundreds of free apps. I can watch movies on my phone that are not file type ".mp4." My home and sleep button on my phone are physically unresponsive so I have an app that allows me to use the screen in replacement for the buttons. I can personalize my home screen with different icons and add a fifth/sixth button to the stationary shortcuts at the bottom of the screen. Easier to customize ringtones. Better battery life. Same loading speed. I get all the perks of an iPhone and galaxy phone in one. If ever I am unsatisfied, it can be reversed and returned to normal state.

The only difference is that you can travel and use your phone with local SIMs, or change carriers whenever you want. iPhones have a different unlocking method than other phones, its status is simply changed by a provider of unlocking services in a database, from "locked" to "unlocked". I attached a video with more info.@
